page.title: 09Newburgh Annual Pageant
page.content: Annually in Newburgh a Pageant is held. A group of people come and ask for Volunteers to perform. There is a different theme every year one year it was the Jungle Book and last year 1984 it was King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table. There is usually a big turn out of people wanting to join but it's not only children that join, some adults join too. The adults have the big parts and the children take on the smaller parts. If you do not like the idea of taking part in the Pageant you can always help to make costumes and props. The Pageant is held in the ruins of Lindores Abbey. There are two nights for the Pageant, one night is for old age pensioners only. The next night is for anyone. The performers usually parade down the High Street before going down to the Abbey.
